paper.title: Option Pricing Model Biases: Bayesian and Markov Chain Monte Carlo Regression Analysis
paper.abstract: We investigate systematic and unsystematic option pricing biases in (a) pure jump Levy, (b) jump-diffusion, (c) stochastic volatility, and (d) GARCH models applied to the Black-Scholes-Merton model. We use options data for trades on the S&P500 index from the CBOE. In addition to standard ordinary least square regression, we employ Bayesian regression and Markov Chain Monte Carlo regression to investigate the moneyness and maturity biases of the models. We demonstrate the usefulness of these advanced methodologies as compared to the benchmark techniques.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究期权定价模型的偏差，并使用了多种模型（如Levy跳跃、跳跃扩散、随机波动率和GARCH模型）来分析S&P500指数期权的定价偏差。这些内容直接涉及衍生品定价领域，特别是期权定价。
